glsa.title: Tor: Information disclosure
glsa.synopsis: A flaw in Tor may allow the disclosure of arbitrary memory portions.

background.p: Tor is an implementation of second generation Onion Routing, a connection-oriented anonymizing communication service.

description.p: A bug in Tor allows attackers to view arbitrary memory contents from an exit server's process space.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit the memory disclosure to gain sensitive information and possibly even private keys.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Tor users should upgrade to the latest available version:
